title: Florida Tax Credit Scholarship (FTC)
shortDescription: Corporate tax credit-funded scholarship providing private school tuition assistance.
description: The Florida Tax Credit Scholarship (FTC) program provides scholarships to eligible low-income Florida students to attend participating private schools. Funded through corporate donations that receive tax credits, this program has helped hundreds of thousands of Florida students access private education. While not autism-specific, many families of children with autism utilize FTC scholarships to attend private schools that offer smaller class sizes, individualized attention, or specialized programs.
benefits: Wide range of participating private schools
No prior public school enrollment required
eligibility: Student must be a Florida resident entering kindergarten through 12th grade. Family income must meet program guidelines (generally at or below 400% of federal poverty level). Priority given to students with prior FTC scholarships and those from lowest income families.
howToApply: Apply through Step Up For Students or AAA Scholarship Foundation. Applications require proof of household income, Florida residency, and student eligibility documentation.
